materials.raw_text: Co: 20 g, Er: 80 g, Ga: 200 g, Tc: 50 g

sourcing.instructions: Co (Cobalt) - Obtain from a chemical supply store or online retailer specializing in metals. Er (Erbium) - Available from specialty chemical suppliers or online marketplaces. Ga (Gallium) - Purchase from suppliers of rare metals. Tc (Technetium) - Order from a licensed nuclear material supplier.
steps: Co (Cobalt) - Obtain from a chemical supply store or online retailer specializing in metals. Er (Erbium) - Available from specialty chemical suppliers or online marketplaces. Ga (Gallium) - Purchase from suppliers of rare metals. Tc (Technetium) - Order from a licensed nuclear material supplier.

1. Weigh out 20 g of Co, 80 g of Er, 200 g of Ga, and 50 g of Tc using a precision balance. 2. Place all measured materials in a clean, dry ceramic or glass mixing container. 3. Using a spatula, thoroughly mix the powders until homogeneous.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out 20 g of Co, 80 g of Er, 200 g of Ga, and 50 g of Tc using a precision balance. 2. Place all measured materials in a clean, dry ceramic or glass mixing container. 3. Using a spatula, thoroughly mix the powders until homogeneous.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed material into a high-temperature furnace. 2. Set the furnace to a temperature of 1200째C. 3. Allow the material to heat for 4 hours to facilitate proper melting and alloying of the components.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed material into a high-temperature furnace. 2. Set the furnace to a temperature of 1200째C. 3. Allow the material to heat for 4 hours to facilitate proper melting and alloying of the components.

steps: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow the sample to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 25째C). 2. This process should take around 6-8 hours.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow the sample to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 25째C). 2. This process should take around 6-8 hours.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the furnace. 2. Inspect the sample for any surface imperfections. 3. If necessary, use fine-grit sandpaper to smooth out any rough edges and surfaces. 4. Optionally, apply a sealant to protect the surface.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the furnace. 2. Inspect the sample for any surface imperfections. 3. If necessary, use fine-grit sandpaper to smooth out any rough edges and surfaces. 4. Optionally, apply a sealant to protect the surface.
